laudā Deum tuum, Sion. ^ Praise the Lor: benedīxit fīliīs tuīs in tē. ^ Because he hath strengthened the bolts of thy gates, he hath blessed thy children within thee.

1 ^ Laudā, Jerosolima, Dominum: 3 ^ Quī posuit fīnēs tuōs pācem, et adipe frūmentī satiat tē. ^ Who hath placed peace in thy borders, and filleth thee with the fat of corn.

laudā Deum tuum, Sion. ^ Praise the Lor: vēlōciter currit sermō ejus. ^ Who sendeth forth his speech to the earth
nebulam sīcut cinerem spargit. ^ Who giveth snow like wool
¿ante faciem frīgoris ejus quis sustinēbit? ^ He sendeth his crystal like morsels
who shall stand before the face of his cold?

1 ^ Laudā, Jerosolima, Dominum: 7 ^ Ēmittet verbum suum, et liquefaciet ea
laudā Deum tuum, Sion. ^ Praise the Lor: flābit spīritus ejus, et fluent aquae. ^ He shall send out his word, and shall melt them
his wind shall blow, and the waters shall run.

laudā Deum tuum, Sion. ^ Praise the Lor: jūstitiās, et jūdicia sua Isrāēlī. ^ Who declareth his word to Jacob
his justices and his judgments to Israel.

1 ^ Laudā, Jerosolima, Dominum: 9 ^ Nōn fēcit tāliter omnī nātiōnī, et jūdicia sua nōn manifestāvit eīs. ^ He hath not done in like manner to every nation, and his judgments he hath not made manifest to them.
